PLUGIN_DESCRIPTION: Receive FM and DAB/DAB+ radio using RTL-SDR USB tuners
ENABLE_FM_DOC: Toggle to show FM radio settings
FM_LOWER_FREQ_DOC: Select the lower FM band limit for your region. Japan uses 76-95 MHz, Italy starts at 87 MHz, Europe at 87.5 MHz, Americas at 88 MHz.
SCAN_FM_DOC: Scan for available FM radio stations
ENABLE_DAB_DOC: Toggle to show DAB and DAB+ radio settings
DAB_PPM_DOC: Frequency correction in parts-per-million for cheap RTL-SDR dongles with inaccurate crystals. Quality dongles (Nooelec NESDR, RTL-SDR Blog V3/V4) work at 0. Cheap generic blue dongles typically need 40-60. If DAB stations are not detected during scan, try values between -100 and +100 in steps of 10 until reception works. Each dongle has its own specific value due to crystal oscillator manufacturing variance.
SCAN_DAB_DOC: Scan for available DAB/DAB+ stations (may take 2-3 minutes)
SCAN_SENSITIVITY_DOC: How sensitive the FM scanner should be when detecting stations. Higher values find only the strongest signals, lower values find more stations but may include noise.
SENSITIVITY_CONSERVATIVE: Conservative (+15 dB) - Very strong signals only
SENSITIVITY_VERY_SENSITIVE: Very Sensitive (+3 dB) - Weaker signals, may include noise
SHOW_WEB_MANAGEMENT_DOC: Toggle to show station manager access options
OPEN_CURRENT_WINDOW_DOC: Opens station manager in iframe within Volumio
OPEN_NEW_TAB_DOC: Opens station manager in new browser tab
SHOW_MANAGEMENT_CONFIG_DOC: Toggle to show advanced manager configuration
ENABLE_MENU_ITEM_DOC: Adds RTL-SDR Manager to Settings menu (requires restart)
HOSTNAME_OVERRIDE_DOC: Leave blank to use MDNS hostname. Enter your IP address (e.g. 192.168.30.208) if MDNS is unavailable
CREATE_BACKUP_DOC: Creates a complete backup of all stations and configuration. Backups are stored in /data/plugins/music_service/rtlsdr_radio/backups/
RESTORE_LATEST_BACKUP_DOC: Restores the most recent full backup (both stations and configuration). The plugin will restart after restore completes.
SHOW_DIAGNOSTICS_DOC: Toggle to show manual testing tools for different USB dongles
DIAGNOSTICS_PURPOSE: These tools test if your USB dongle can receive specific frequencies. Use this when: stations won't play, signal is weak, or testing a new dongle. Enter a known strong station, save settings, click test - you should hear audio. If no audio or distorted, adjust gain: lower if crackling (NESDR Smart: try 20), higher if silent (basic RTL-SDR: try 80). Test confirms your dongle works before scanning for all stations.
DIAGNOSTICS_SAVE_EXPLANATION: Save test values for next time.
MANUAL_FM_FREQUENCY_DOC: FM frequency in MHz (88.0-108.0). Example: 94.9 for BBC Radio London, 95.8 for Capital FM. Use a strong local station for testing.
TEST_FM_SAVE_REQUIRED: Required: Test uses saved values. Save settings first to test current frequency.
MANUAL_DAB_ENSEMBLE_DOC: Ensemble ID that broadcasts the service (e.g., 12B for BBC Radio1 in UK). Use DAB scan to discover ensembles in your location.
MANUAL_DAB_SERVICE_DOC: Exact service name as broadcast (e.g., BBC Radio1 not BBC Radio 1). This is the technical identifier from the ensemble, which may differ from the station's display name.
MANUAL_DAB_GAIN_DOC: RTL-SDR RF amplifier gain (0-100). Affects signal-to-noise ratio and overload threshold, not volume. NESDR Smart dongles have better amplifiers: start at 20. Generic RTL-SDR needs higher gain: start at 80. Adjust if distorted (lower) or no signal (higher).
MANUAL_DAB_PPM_DOC: PPM frequency correction for testing. Try values from -100 to +100 in steps of 10. Most cheap blue dongles need 40-60. Quality dongles (Nooelec, RTL-SDR Blog) work at 0.
TEST_DAB_SAVE_REQUIRED: Required: Test uses saved values. Save settings first to test current station.
TOAST_OPERATION_QUEUED_MSG: Operation will start when device becomes available (60s timeout)
TOAST_RESTART_REQUIRED: Settings saved. Please restart Volumio for changes to take effect.
TOAST_DELETED_STATION: Cannot play deleted station. Restore it first from Settings.
TOAST_CLEARED_FM: Moved {0} FM stations to recycle bin
TOAST_CLEARED_DAB: Moved {0} DAB stations to recycle bin
CONFIRM_CLEAR_FM_MSG: Move all {0} FM stations to recycle bin? You can restore them later or permanently delete them.
CONFIRM_CLEAR_DAB_MSG: Move all {0} DAB stations to recycle bin? You can restore them later or permanently delete them.
CONFIRM_RESCAN_FM: Rescan for FM stations? This will take 10-30 seconds. New stations will be added and existing favorites/customizations will be preserved.
CONFIRM_RESCAN_DAB: Rescan for DAB stations? This will take 2-5 minutes. New stations will be added and existing favorites/customizations will be preserved.
CONFIRM_EMPTY_RECYCLE_MSG: Permanently delete {0} station(s)? This cannot be undone.
CONFIRM_DELETE_ONE: Move this station to recycle bin?
CONFIRM_PURGE_ONE: Permanently delete this station? This cannot be undone.
WARN_FREQ_CHANGE_MSG: You are about to change the frequency for "{0}"
WARN_FREQ_CHANGE_DETAILS: This will affect playback. Make sure the new frequency is correct. Only proceed if you know this station broadcasts on {0} MHz.
WARN_FREQ_DUPLICATE: Warning: {0} MHz already exists in your station list
WARN_FREQ_INVALID: Invalid frequency. Must be between 87.5 and 108.0 MHz
RECYCLE_NOTICE: Deleted stations are kept here until purged. You can restore them or permanently delete them.
BROWSE_NO_FAVORITES_DESC: Add stations to favorites from FM or DAB lists
BROWSE_NO_RECENT_DESC: Play some stations to see them here
BROWSE_NO_FM_DESC: Click Rescan to search for stations
BROWSE_EDIT_INFO: To edit stations: Settings > Plugins > FM/DAB Radio
BROWSE_NO_DAB_DESC: Click Rescan to search for stations
BROWSE_PURGE_ALL_DESC: Remove all deleted stations from database
MAINTENANCE_UPLOAD_ACCEPTED: Accepted: .zip files (stations, config, or full backups)
MAINTENANCE_CONFIRM_RESTORE_MSG: This will restore selected backups. The plugin will restart and current playback will stop.
ANTENNA_TOOLS_DESC: Use these tools to optimize antenna positioning for best DAB reception. Run spectrum scan first for quick overview, then validate specific channels.
SPECTRUM_WHAT_DESC: Raw radio frequency power across entire DAB band (174-240 MHz)
SPECTRUM_USE_DESC: Initial antenna positioning - quickly see WHERE signals exist in your area
SPECTRUM_LIMIT_DESC: Shows RF power only, NOT whether signal is decodable DAB
VALIDATION_WHAT_DESC: Which DAB channels can actually be decoded and provide audio
VALIDATION_USE_DESC: Fine-tuning antenna after spectrum scan shows signals - verify decode capability
SNR_WHAT_DESC: Signal-to-Noise Ratio for each channel across different gain settings
SNR_USE_DESC: Finding optimal gain setting for your location and antenna setup
SNR_SPEED_DESC: 2-3 seconds per gain step (total time depends on gain range)
SNR_ADVANTAGE_DESC: Automatically determines best gain for maximum signal quality
SNR_NO_SCANNED_CHANNELS: No scanned DAB channels found. Run a DAB scan first.
SNR_NO_VALIDATED_CHANNELS: No validated channels found. Run Channel Validation (Tool 2) first.
SNR_GUIDANCE: Apply this value to DAB Gain in the plugin settings for optimal signal reception. The same value may work for FM Gain too.
SNR_GAIN_NOTE: RTL-SDR Blog V4 (R828D): extend range to 70 for optimal results
WORKFLOW_STEP_1_DESC: See if ANY signals present in your location. Identify frequency ranges with activity. Quick overview (2 seconds).
WORKFLOW_STEP_2_TITLE: Step 2: Adjust antenna based on spectrum
WORKFLOW_STEP_2_DESC: Rotate/reposition antenna for stronger peaks in spectrum display. Re-scan to compare results.
WORKFLOW_STEP_3_DESC: Verify signals are actually DAB. Confirm decode capability. See which ensembles work reliably.
WORKFLOW_STEP_4_DESC: Adjust for maximum Strong or Excellent channels. Re-validate to confirm improvement.
WORKFLOW_NOTE_DESC: Spectrum shows WHERE RF exists. Validation shows IF it's usable DAB. Strong RF does not guarantee decodable signal - could be interference or wrong modulation.
SELECT_CHANNELS: Please select at least one channel
BLOCKLIST_INFO: Add phrases that should NOT trigger artwork lookup. These are typically station slogans, show names, or promotional messages - not song metadata. One phrase per line.
BLOCKLIST_PLACEHOLDER:
We love pop!
Best radio playing...
Greatest Hits at Breakfast
BLOCKLIST_DEFAULTS_INFO: The plugin includes built-in universal patterns for frequencies, URLs, phone numbers, and technical data. These cannot be edited but are always active.
BLOCKLIST_RESET_MSG: This will replace your custom phrases with the default list. Continue?
BLOCKLIST_EMPTY_MSG: Saving an empty block list means all broadcast text will trigger artwork lookups. This may cause false matches. Continue?
SHOW_ARTWORK_SETTINGS_DOC: Toggle to show artwork configuration options
BEST_EFFORT_ARTWORK_DOC: Enable metadata parsing and artwork lookups. When disabled, only raw broadcast text is shown with default radio icons. Disable for headless systems to reduce CPU and network usage.
ARTWORK_THRESHOLD_DOC: Minimum metadata confidence required to trigger artwork lookup. Lower values find more artwork but may have false matches. Higher values are more accurate but may miss some tracks.
ARTWORK_PERSISTENCE_DOC: Controls when artwork is replaced. 'Keep until artist changes' prevents flickering during track playback.
ARTWORK_TTL_DOC: Automatically reset artwork to station default after this period if no new artist is detected. Useful for audiobooks, spoken word, or long DJ sets. Set to Disabled to keep artwork indefinitely.
ARTWORK_DEBUG_LOGGING_DOC: Enable verbose logging of artwork lookups, cache hits/misses, and Last.fm requests. Useful for troubleshooting but generates many log entries. Disable for normal use.
CSV_EXPORT_DESC: Download your stations as CSV files for backup or editing.
CSV_TEMPLATES_DESC: Download empty templates to create new station lists.
CSV_IMPORT_DESC: Upload a CSV file to add or update stations.
CSV_OP_REPLACE_DESC: Clear existing stations and import all from CSV
CSV_OP_AMEND_DESC: Update matching stations, keep others unchanged
CSV_OP_EXTEND_DESC: Add new stations only, skip duplicates
CSV_OP_REMOVE_DESC: Delete stations that match CSV entries
